g.title: G
g.text: Graph for Jeffrey Epstein

g.title: Aaron Rodgers
g.text: Aaron Rodgers
• He became the Packers' starting quarterback in 2008 and led them to a Super Bowl XLV victory in 2011, earning Super Bowl MVP honors.
• He has won the NFL MVP award four times (2011, 2014, 2020, 2021) and is considered one of the greatest quarterbacks of all time.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Jeffrey Epstein
• He was arrested in 2006 and 2019 on charges related to sex trafficking and abuse of minors.
• In 2008, he pleaded guilty to procuring a child for prostitution and served 13 months in custody.

g.title: Aaron Rodgers->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Subject of conspiracy theories discussed by Rodgers

g.title: Adam McKay
g.text: Adam McKay
• Won an Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay for 'The Big Short' in 2015.
• Began career as head writer for 'Saturday Night Live' from 1995 to 2001.

g.title: Adam McKay->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Produced podcast series about his case

g.title: Adnan Khashoggi
g.text: Adnan Khashoggi
• Known as a Saudi businessman and arms dealer with a peak net worth of around $4 billion in the early 1980s.
• Born in Mecca, Saudi Arabia on July 25, 1935, and died in London, England on June 6, 2017.

g.title: Alan Dershowitz
g.text: Alan Dershowitz
• Represented high-profile clients such as O.J. Simpson, Mike Tyson, and Jeffrey Epstein.
• Taught at Harvard Law School from 1964 to 2013, becoming the youngest full professor of law in the school's history at age 28.

g.title: Alan Dershowitz->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Defense Attorney

g.title: Albert Bryan Jr.
g.text: Albert Bryan Jr.
• Elected as the 9th Governor of the United States Virgin Islands, taking office on January 7, 2019.
• Won reelection in 2022, defeating Senator Kurt Vialet with 56% of the vote.

g.title: Albert Bryan Jr.->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Allegedly suggested donations to local causes

g.title: Alec Baldwin
g.text: Alec Baldwin
• From 2006 to 2013, he starred as Jack Donaghy on '30 Rock', winning two Primetime Emmy Awards and three Golden Globe Awards.
• In 2021, he was involved in a shooting incident on the set of 'Rust', leading to legal challenges and a wrongful death lawsuit.

g.title: Alex Rosen
g.text: Alex Rosen
• Founded Predator Poachers in Houston, Texas at age 19 in 2019.
• The organization claims responsibility for arrests in 46 U.S. states and convictions in 33 by 2023.

g.title: Alex Rosen->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Accused Bill Clinton of visiting his island

g.title: Alexander Acosta
g.text: Alexander Acosta
• Approved a controversial plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein in 2008, which later led to criticism and his resignation as Secretary of Labor.
• Served as the 27th United States Secretary of Labor from April 28, 2017, to July 19, 2019, under President Donald Trump.

g.title: Alexander Acosta->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Approved a plea deal for during tenure as U.S. Attorney

g.title: Alice S. Fisher
g.text: Alice S. Fisher
• Served as United States Assistant Attorney General for the Criminal Division from August 31, 2005, to May 23, 2008, under President George W. Bush.
• Interviewed for the position of FBI Director in May 2017 but withdrew from consideration.

g.title: Alice S. Fisher->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Oversaw DOJ during his sex crimes case

g.title: Alison Nathan
g.text: Alison Nathan
• Appointed by President Joe Biden as a judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in 2022.
• Served as a United States district judge for the Southern District of New York from 2011 to 2022.

g.title: Alison Nathan->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Presided over the trial involving associate

g.title: Andrew Cuomo
g.text: Andrew Cuomo
• Served as the 56th Governor of New York from January 1, 2011, to August 23, 2021.
• Faced numerous allegations of sexual misconduct, leading to his resignation in August 2021.

g.title: Andrew Neil
g.text: Andrew Neil
• Editor of The Sunday Times from 1983 to 1994, appointed by Rupert Murdoch.
• Presented various political programs on BBC and Channel 4, including The Andrew Neil Show.

g.title: Andrew Neil->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Denied any association with

g.title: Anna Malova
g.text: Anna Malova
• Won Miss Baltic Sea 1994 and Miss Russia 1998, placing in the Top 10 at Miss Universe 1998.
• In 2019, flight logs revealed she flew on Jeffrey Epstein's plane with Ghislaine Maxwell and Prince Andrew.

g.title: Anna Malova->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Flew on Epstein's plane in 1999

g.title: Ari Ben-Menashe
g.text: Ari Ben-Menashe
• Arrested in 1989 in the U.S. for attempting to sell military aircraft to Iran but was acquitted in 1990.
• Worked for Israel's Military Intelligence Directorate from 1977 to 1987.

g.title: Ari Ben-Menashe->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Claimed Epstein was a Mossad spy

g.title: Bill Clinton
g.text: Bill Clinton
• Served as the 42nd President of the United States from January 20, 1993, to January 20, 2001.
• Impeached by the House of Representatives on December 19, 1998, but acquitted by the Senate.

g.title: Bill Clinton->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Associated with through flights

g.title: Bill Gates
g.text: Bill Gates
• Co-founded Microsoft in 1975 with Paul Allen in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
• Transitioned to full-time work at the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation in 2008.

g.title: Bill Gates->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Met for philanthropic discussions

g.title: Bill Richardson
g.text: Bill Richardson
• Served as the 30th Governor of New Mexico from January 1, 2003, to January 1, 2011.
• Held the position of United States Secretary of Energy from August 18, 1998, to January 20, 2001, under President Bill Clinton.

g.title: Bill Richardson->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Alleged involvement in trafficking ring with

g.title: Carole Radziwill
g.text: Carole Radziwill
• Worked as a journalist and producer for ABC News, earning three Emmy Awards, a Peabody Award, and a GLAAD Media Award.
• Authored a memoir, 'What Remains: A Memoir of Fate, Friendship and Love', which became a New York Times bestseller in 2005.

g.title: Carole Radziwill->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Listed in contact book

g.title: Cheney Mason
g.text: Cheney Mason
• Served as co-counsel in the high-profile Casey Anthony trial in 2011.
• Born on December 12, 1943, in Jacksonville, Florida.

g.title: Cheney Mason->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Attorney for accuser in 2016 rape lawsuit

g.title: Cyrus Vance Jr.
g.text: Cyrus Vance Jr.
• Served as the 36th District Attorney of New York County from January 1, 2010, to January 1, 2022.
• Did not seek reelection in 2021 and was succeeded by Alvin Bragg.

g.title: Cyrus Vance Jr.->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Office sought reduced sex-offender status for

g.title: Damian Williams (lawyer)
g.text: Damian Williams (lawyer)
• Appointed by President Joe Biden, he served as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York from October 10, 2021, to December 13, 2024.
• He earned a BA in economics from Harvard University in 2002, an MPhil in international relations from Emmanuel College, Cambridge in 2003, and a JD from Yale Law School in 2007.

g.title: Damian Williams (lawyer)->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Oversaw cases related to Jeffrey Epstein's associate

g.title: David Boies
g.text: David Boies
• Represented Al Gore in the Bush v. Gore case following the 2000 U.S. presidential election.
• Gained national prominence for leading the U.S. government's prosecution of Microsoft in 2001.

g.title: David Boies->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Attorney for victims

g.title: David Copperfield (illusionist)
g.text: David Copperfield (illusionist)
• He has performed illusions such as making the Statue of Liberty disappear and walking through the Great Wall of China.
• As of 2006, he had sold 33 million tickets and grossed over $4 billion, more than any other solo entertainer in history.

g.title: David Copperfield (illusionist)->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Listed as an associate in 2024 documents

g.title: David Koch
g.text: David Koch
• Donated over $1.3 billion to philanthropic causes, including significant contributions to medical research and cultural institutions.
• Joined Koch Industries in 1970, became president of Koch Engineering in 1979, and co-owner of Koch Industries in 1983.

g.title: David Schoen
g.text: David Schoen
• Represented former President Donald Trump during his second impeachment trial in the United States Senate.
• Specializes in federal criminal defense and civil rights law, with a practice based in Alabama.

g.title: David Schoen->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Briefly represented Jeffrey Epstein before his death

g.title: Dmitry Rybolovlev
g.text: Dmitry Rybolovlev
• Became chairman of Uralkali, a Russian fertilizer producer, in 1995 and sold his majority share in 2010 for $6.5 billion.
• Acquired a 66% stake in AS Monaco football club in 2011, becoming its president.

g.title: Don Johnson
g.text: Don Johnson
• Gained fame as Sonny Crockett in the 1980s TV series 'Miami Vice', winning a Golden Globe in 1986.
• Starred in the TV series 'Nash Bridges' from 1996 to 2001, playing the titular role.

g.title: Donald Barr
g.text: Donald Barr
• Served as headmaster of the Dalton School in New York City from 1964 to 1974.
• Born in Manhattan, New York on August 8, 1921, and passed away on February 5, 2004, in Langhorne, Pennsylvania.

g.title: Donald Barr->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Former headmaster where Jeffrey Epstein was employed

g.title: Donald Trump
g.text: Donald Trump
• Served as the 45th president of the United States from January 20, 2017, to January 20, 2021, and began his second term as the 47th president on January 20, 2025.
• Faced two impeachments during his first presidency, in 2019 for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress, and in 2021 for incitement of insurrection, but was acquitted both times.

g.title: Donny Deutsch
g.text: Donny Deutsch
• Sold Deutsch Inc. to the Interpublic Group of Companies in 2000 for $265 million.
• Joined his father's advertising firm in 1983 and became chairman in 1989.

g.title: Doug Band
g.text: Doug Band
• He served as Deputy Assistant and later counselor to President Bill Clinton, playing a key role in Clinton's post-presidency.
• He created the Clinton Global Initiative, which raised $69 billion for philanthropic projects.

g.title: Doug Band->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Urged Bill Clinton to cease relationship with Epstein

g.title: Draft:Clay Clark
g.text: Draft:Clay Clark
• He organizes the ReAwaken America Tour, which protests COVID-19 measures and supports conspiracy theories related to the 2020 U.S. presidential election.
• Born in 1980, he is a conservative business coach, author, podcaster, and entrepreneur based in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

g.title: Draft:Clay Clark->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Accused of creating a new race of humans in a conspiracy theory

g.title: Dylan Howard
g.text: Dylan Howard
• Served as editor-in-chief of the National Enquirer from 2014 to 2020, overseeing numerous high-profile scandals.
• CEO of Empire Media Group, Inc., which owns 12 digital and print brands, and chairman of Pantheon Media Group.

g.title: Ehud Barak
g.text: Ehud Barak
• Served as the 10th Prime Minister of Israel from 1999 to 2001.
• Held the position of Chief of General Staff in the Israel Defense Forces from 1991 to 1995.

g.title: Ehud Barak->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Visited multiple times between 2013 and 2017

g.title: Eliot Spitzer
g.text: Eliot Spitzer
• Resigned as Governor following a prostitution scandal in March 2008.
• Served as the 54th Governor of New York from January 1, 2007, to March 17, 2008.

g.title: Elizabeth II
g.text: Elizabeth II
• Reigned as Queen of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth realms from 6 February 1952 to 8 September 2022.
• Her reign of 70 years and 214 days is the longest of any British monarch and the longest of any queen regnant in history.

g.title: Elizabeth II->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Associated with Son

g.title: Elizabeth Loftus
g.text: Elizabeth Loftus
• She is renowned for her research on the misinformation effect and false memories, significantly impacting legal proceedings and psychological understanding.
• She has provided expert testimony in over 300 court cases, including high-profile trials such as those of Ted Bundy and O.J. Simpson.

g.title: Elizabeth Loftus->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Consultant in legal case involving associate

g.title: Eric Lander
g.text: Eric Lander
• Played a significant role in the Human Genome Project, contributing to the sequencing of the human genome.
• Served as the 11th Director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy under President Joe Biden from June 2021 to February 2022.

g.title: Eric Lander->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Attended gatherings where Epstein was present

g.title: Fidel Castro
g.text: Fidel Castro
• He became Prime Minister of Cuba in 1959 after leading the Cuban Revolution that overthrew President Fulgencio Batista.
• He served as the First Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba from 1965 to 2011, establishing a one-party socialist state.

g.title: Gabriel Sherman
g.text: Gabriel Sherman
• Published a biography of Roger Ailes in 2014, which debuted at #9 on The New York Times Bestseller list.
• Worked as a special correspondent for Vanity Fair and contributed to NBC News and MSNBC.

g.title: Gabriel Sherman->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Wrote about Jeffrey Epstein in Vanity Fair article

g.title: Geoffrey Berman
g.text: Geoffrey Berman
• Served as United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York from January 2018 to June 2020.
• Oversaw high-profile investigations, including those involving Michael Cohen and Jeffrey Epstein.

g.title: Geoffrey Berman->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Charged with sex trafficking under Berman's office

g.title: George J. Mitchell
g.text: George J. Mitchell
• Served as United States Senator from Maine from 1980 to 1995 and as Senate Majority Leader from 1989 to 1995.
• Played a key role in the Northern Ireland peace process, leading to the Good Friday Agreement in 1998.

g.title: George J. Mitchell->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Mitchell named in documents related to Epstein scandal

g.title: George Stephanopoulos
g.text: George Stephanopoulos
• Served as Senior Advisor to President Bill Clinton from 1993 to 1996.
• Co-anchor of 'Good Morning America' and host of 'This Week' on ABC.

g.title: George Stephanopoulos->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Dinner Party Attendee with

g.title: Gerald B. Lefcourt
g.text: Gerald B. Lefcourt
• Represented high-profile clients including Jeffrey Epstein, the Black Panthers, and Russell Crowe.
• Graduated from Brooklyn Law School in 1967 and leads a criminal defense firm in New York City.

g.title: Gerald B. Lefcourt->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Defense Attorney

g.title: Geraldo Rivera
g.text: Geraldo Rivera
• He gained fame with the 1986 TV special 'The Mystery of Al Capone's Vaults' and hosted the talk show 'Geraldo' from 1987 to 1998.
• He worked at Fox News Channel from 2001 to 2023, serving as a war correspondent and co-host of 'The Five'.

g.title: Geraldo Rivera->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Commented on Epstein's associate Ghislaine Maxwell

g.title: Ghislaine Maxwell
g.text: Ghislaine Maxwell
• In 2021, she was convicted of child sex trafficking and other offenses related to Jeffrey Epstein, receiving a 20-year prison sentence.
• She was arrested in July 2020 in New Hampshire and is currently incarcerated at FCI Tallahassee.

g.title: Ghislaine Maxwell->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Associate and former partner of

g.title: Glenn Dubin
g.text: Glenn Dubin
• Co-founded Highbridge Capital Management in 1992, which was later acquired by J.P. Morgan Asset Management.
• Founded Engineers Gate Manager LP, a quantitative-trading firm, in 2013.

g.title: Glenn Dubin->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Maintained a friendship and business relationship

g.title: Gloria Allred
g.text: Gloria Allred
• She is known for representing clients in high-profile civil rights cases, including those involving sexual harassment and women's rights.
• She was admitted to the State Bar of California in 1975 and co-founded the law firm Allred, Maroko & Goldberg in 1976.

g.title: Graydon Carter
g.text: Graydon Carter
• Served as editor-in-chief of U.S. Vanity Fair from 1992 to 2017.
• Co-founded the satirical magazine Spy in 1986.

g.title: Graydon Carter->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Removed allegations from Vanity Fair article about

g.title: Harvey Weinstein
g.text: Harvey Weinstein
• Born in Queens, New York, in 1952, he co-founded Miramax Films in 1979.
• He was a prominent film producer, winning an Academy Award for 'Shakespeare in Love' in 1998.

g.title: Jamie Dimon
g.text: Jamie Dimon
• Became CEO of JPMorgan Chase in 2006, after serving as COO following the merger with Bank One.
• Under his leadership, JPMorgan Chase was fined $38 billion for legal and regulatory infractions.

g.title: Jamie Dimon->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: JPMorgan Chase faced lawsuits for serving

g.title: Jeff Bezos
g.text: Jeff Bezos
• Founded Amazon in 1994, which became the world's largest e-commerce and cloud computing company.
• Founded Blue Origin in 2000, an aerospace manufacturer and sub-orbital spaceflight services company.

g.title: Jimmy Buffett
g.text: Jimmy Buffett
• Known for his tropical rock sound and hit song 'Margaritaville' released in 1977.
• Born on December 25, 1946, in Pascagoula, Mississippi, and died on September 1, 2023, in Sag Harbor, New York.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->Jimmy Buffett

g.title: John Kerry
g.text: John Kerry
• Served as the 68th United States Secretary of State from February 1, 2013, to January 20, 2017, under President Barack Obama.
• Represented Massachusetts in the United States Senate from January 2, 1985, to February 1, 2013.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->John Kerry

g.title: John N. Mitchell
g.text: John N. Mitchell
• Convicted for his involvement in the Watergate scandal, leading to a prison sentence in 1977, of which he served 19 months.
• Served as the 67th United States Attorney General from January 21, 1969, to March 1, 1972, under President Richard Nixon.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->John N. Mitchell

g.title: Katie Couric
g.text: Katie Couric
• She became the first solo female anchor of a major network evening news program at CBS in 2006.
• From 1989 to 2006, she was a prominent figure at NBC News, co-hosting the 'Today' show.

g.title: Ken Starr
g.text: Ken Starr
• Served as Independent Counsel for the Whitewater Controversy from 1994 to 1998, leading to the impeachment of President Bill Clinton.
• Was the President and Chancellor of Baylor University from 2010 to 2016, resigning amid a sexual assault scandal.

g.title: Kevin Spacey
g.text: Kevin Spacey
• He won two Academy Awards: Best Supporting Actor for 'The Usual Suspects' (1995) and Best Actor for 'American Beauty' (1999).
• Faced multiple allegations of sexual misconduct starting in 2017, leading to legal battles and career setbacks.

g.text: Lisa Bloom

• Graduated from UCLA with a BA and Yale Law School with a JD in 1986.

g.text: Loretta Preska
• Appointed as a judge for the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York by President George H. W. Bush in 1992.
• Served as Chief Judge of the Southern District of New York from 2009 to 2016.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->Loretta Preska

g.title: Lynn Forester de Rothschild
g.text: Lynn Forester de Rothschild
• Born on July 2, 1954, in Oradell, New Jersey, she pursued higher education at Pomona College and Columbia University, earning a BA and JD respectively.
• She became the chair of E.L. Rothschild, a holding company managing investments in The Economist Group and other sectors.

g.title: Mark Zuckerberg

• Launched Facebook in February 2004 while attending Harvard University, later dropping out to focus on the company.
• Became the world's youngest self-made billionaire in 2008 at the age of 23.

g.title: Michael Bloomberg
g.text: Michael Bloomberg
• He co-founded Bloomberg L.P. in 1981, serving as its CEO from 1981 to 2001 and again from 2014 to 2023.
• He served as the 108th Mayor of New York City from January 1, 2002, to December 31, 2013.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->Michael Bloomberg
g.text: Acquaintance at social gatherings

g.title: Michael Jackson
g.text: Michael Jackson
• His 1982 album 'Thriller' became the best-selling album of all time, with estimated sales of 70 million copies worldwide.
• He began his music career at age six with his brothers in the Jackson 5, achieving fame with Motown Records in 1968.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->Michael Jackson

g.text: Michael Wolff (journalist)
• Authored 'Fire and Fury' in 2018, a bestseller about the Trump White House.
• Received two National Magazine Awards and a Mirror Award for his journalism.

g.text: Mike Pence
• Served as the 48th Vice President of the United States from 2017 to 2021 under President Donald Trump.
• Member of the U.S. House of Representatives from 2001 to 2013, representing Indiana's 2nd and 6th districts.

• He co-founded Boston Properties and served as its executive chairman.

• She was the first black woman to appear on the covers of Time and Vogue France.

• In 1985, he acquired Revlon, a major cosmetics company, which became one of his most notable business ventures.

• Served as president of Alphabet Inc., Google's parent company, until December 3, 2019.

g.text: Stephen Hawking
• Diagnosed with a rare form of motor neurone disease at age 21, which gradually paralyzed him over decades.
• Developed the theory of Hawking radiation, predicting that black holes emit radiation.

g.text: Steve Bannon
• In 2020, he was charged with fraud and money laundering related to the We Build the Wall campaign but was pardoned by Trump in 2021.

• Played a key role in the Northern Ireland peace process, leading to the Good Friday Agreement in 1998.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->Tony Blair
g.text: Listed in Epstein's contact book

g.title: Tony Randall
g.text: Tony Randall
• He is best known for his role as Felix Unger in the television adaptation of 'The Odd Couple' from 1970 to 1975, for which he won an Emmy Award.
• Born Aryeh Leonard Rosenberg on February 26, 1920, in Tulsa, Oklahoma, he served in the U.S. Army Signal Corps during World War II, achieving the rank of first lieutenant.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->Tony Randall
g.text: Presided over event honoring Robert Maxwell attended by Epstein

g.title: Virginia Giuffre
g.text: Virginia Giuffre
• She was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking ring and has been an advocate for justice for survivors.
• In 2015, she sued Ghislaine Maxwell for defamation, resulting in a settlement in her favor in 2017.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->Virginia Giuffre
g.text: Accuser of Epstein and Maxwell

g.title: William Barr
g.text: William Barr
• Born in New York City in 1950, he served as U.S. Attorney General under Presidents George H. W. Bush and Donald Trump.
• He was involved in the controversial handling of the Mueller Report and faced criticism for his summary of its findings.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->William Barr
g.text: Attorney General overseeing Epstein's death investigation

g.title: Woody Allen
g.text: Woody Allen
• Directed and starred in 'Annie Hall' (1977), winning four Academy Awards including Best Picture.
• Born Allan Stewart Konigsberg on November 30, 1935, in New York City.

g.title: Jeffrey Epstein->Woody Allen
g.text: Acquaintance at social events

g.title: Jesse Watters
g.text: Jesse Watters
• Started his career at Fox News as a production assistant in New York City and began appearing on 'The O'Reilly Factor' in 2004.
• Became a co-host of 'The Five' in April 2017 and launched 'Jesse Watters Primetime' on Fox News in January 2022.

g.title: Jesse Watters->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Referenced in comments about QAnon

g.title: John Stanley Pottinger
g.text: John Stanley Pottinger
• Served as United States Assistant Attorney General for the Civil Rights Division from 1973 to 1977 under Presidents Nixon and Ford.
• Discovered the identity of Watergate's Deep Throat as Mark Felt, maintaining the secret until 2005.

g.title: John Stanley Pottinger->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Legal Representative for survivors of

g.title: Kathryn Ruemmler
g.text: Kathryn Ruemmler
• Served as White House Counsel to President Barack Obama from June 30, 2011, to June 2, 2014.
• Worked as a federal prosecutor and was deputy director of the DOJ's Enron Task Force, delivering the closing argument in the trial of Enron executives Kenneth Lay and Jeffrey Skilling.

g.title: Kathryn Ruemmler->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Acquaintance with Regret

g.text: Ken Klippenstein

• Known for using the Freedom of Information Act extensively in his journalism.

g.title: L. Lin Wood
g.text: L. Lin Wood
• Surrendered his law license in July 2023 amid investigations and possible disciplinary actions by the State Bar of Georgia.
• Gained national recognition as a defamation lawyer after representing Richard Jewell in the 1996 Centennial Olympic Park bombing case.

g.title: L. Lin Wood->Jeffrey Epstein
g.text: Claimed was alive and could reveal truths

g.title: Lady Victoria Hervey
g.text: Lady Victoria Hervey
• Born on 6 October 1976 in St Marylebone, London, England, she is the eldest child of the 6th Marquess of Bristol.
• She pursued a career in modeling, working for Christian Dior, and later opened a fashion boutique in Knightsbridge.

g.title: Lady Victoria Hervey->Jeffrey Epstein

g.text: Lawrence B. Jones

g.title: Lawrence Lessig
g.text: Lawrence Lessig
• Founded Creative Commons in 2001, promoting legal sharing of creative works.

g.title: Lawrence Summers
g.text: Lawrence Summers
• Served as the 71st United States Secretary of the Treasury from 1999 to 2001 under President Bill Clinton.

g.text: Had a reported connection during Harvard presidency

• Became a prominent supporter of QAnon conspiracy theories starting in 2017.

g.title: Lynne Patton

g.title: Mary Jo White
g.text: Mary Jo White

• Co-founded the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation in 2000, the world's largest private charitable organization.

g.text: Michael Moore
• He won the 2002 Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature for 'Bowling for Columbine', which explored gun culture in the U.S.

• Known for his role in rebranding the Labour Party as New Labour and was a key figure in the 1997 general election victory.

• Served as a United States District Judge for the Southern District of New York from 1978 to 1991, appointed by President Jimmy Carter.

• Worked as a federal prosecutor in the Southern District of New York from 1998 to 2008, receiving the Department of Justice Director's Award for Superior Performance.

g.title: Sigal Mandelker
g.text: Sigal Mandelker
• Served as Under Secretary of the Treasury for Terrorism and Financial Intelligence from June 2017 to October 2019.
• Played a significant role in the Trump administration's Iran policy, overseeing financial sanctions against Iran.
